abstract: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company reports net loss of $286 million in third quarter, compared to net income of $508.7 million in quarter year earlier, and announces first-ever share buyback plan, in which private equity firm will buy back $500 million in shares.
lead_paragraph: The firm also announced plans to buy back $500 million of its shares and make fixed distributions to shareholders.

headline.main: Kohlberg Kravis Posts Big Loss as Private Equity Struggles
headline.print_headline: Big Quarterly Loss at K.K.R. as Private Equity Struggles

snippet: The firm also announced plans to buy back $500 million of its shares and make fixed distributions to shareholders.
